clause: ASSIGNMENT. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, neither party shall, without the prior written consent of the other, assign this Agreement or any rights or obligations hereunder to any third party, except in the event of a sale of all or substantially all of the assets of either party's language school business in Hamgyong-namdo, in which case, this Agreement shall be assigned to the acquiring party and shall remain in full force and effect.

Prior Inventions. The Consultant represents that no inventions, improvements, or discoveries made or conceived by the Consultant prior to the term of this Agreement, which are related to the matters encompassed by this Agreement, have been made or conceived by the Consultant, except as are listed below and attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. The Consultant shall not, without the prior written consent of the Client, disclose or use for the benefit of the Client any confidential or proprietary information of a third party, including but not limited to any inventions, improvements, or discoveries made or conceived by the Consultant prior to the term of this Agreement. The parties agree to appoint a Partnership Representative, who shall be responsible for making decisions and taking actions on behalf of the partnership in all matters related to the provision of graphic design services in Antarctica, including but not limited to, negotiations with telecommunications and media providers, and compliance with relevant laws and regulations in the territory. clause: Neither party shall be liable for any failure to perform or delay in performing any of its obligations under this Agreement if such failure or delay is due to any event of force majeure including, without limitation, war, riot, civil commotion, earthquake, hurricane, flood, or other natural disaster, fire, explosion, or any other circumstance beyond the reasonable control of either party, as determined by the laws of the country where the property is located in South America.

clause: RELEASE OF LIABILITY. In consideration of the mutual covenants contained in this Agreement and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties agree to release, acquit and forever discharge each other, their officers, directors, employees, agents and their respective successors and assigns, from any and all claims, demands, causes of action, suits, liabilities, damages, losses, costs and expenses of any kind or nature, whether known or unknown, which they may have against each other arising out of or in any way related to the administration of housing programs, urban planning, and community development in the urban area, prior to the date of this Agreement, including but not limited to any claims arising under any federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation, except for any claims arising under this Agreement.

clause: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, in the event that either party hereto intends to assign, transfer, or otherwise dispose of any rights or interests in any copyrights protected under the laws of the Åland Islands, the other party shall have a preemptive right to purchase or otherwise acquire such rights or interests, such right to be exercised within thirty (30) days of receipt of written notice of the intended assignment, transfer, or disposition.

This Agreement shall be deemed to have come into effect on the 7th day of October, 1976 ('the Execution Date'), and shall govern the transportation of goods by truck in and around South America, in accordance with the laws and regulations of the relevant jurisdictions.

TRANSFER OF OWNERSHIP CLAUSE: This clause is made on February 24, 2022, and shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Antarctica, to the extent applicable. In the event of a transfer of ownership of any vehicle utilized for truck transportation within Antarctica, the transferor shall provide written notice to the transferee of any and all permits, licenses, and approvals required for the operation of such vehicle within the territory. Upon execution of this transfer, the transferee shall assume all responsibilities and liabilities associated with the ownership and operation of the vehicle, including but not limited to compliance with all applicable laws and regulations governing truck transportation in Antarctica. The transferor shall not be liable for any damages or claims arising from the operation of the vehicle following the effective date of the transfer.

13.1 Rent Escalation: The rent payable under this employment contract shall be subject to an annual increase of 5% or such other percentage as may be determined by the Tokelau National Statistics Office's Consumer Price Index (CPI), whichever is higher. The first such increase shall take effect on the first anniversary of the commencement date of this contract, and subsequent increases shall take effect on each successive anniversary of the commencement date. The parties agree to review the rent amount every 12 months to ensure it remains fair and reasonable, taking into account any changes in the CPI and the employee's cost of living in Tokelau.

Each party shall, at the request of the other party and at its own expense, execute and deliver, or cause to be executed and delivered, such further instruments and take such further actions as may be reasonably necessary to give full effect to the provisions of this Agreement, in accordance with the laws of the country in which the business is conducted, specifically in South America, and the regulations of the Healthcare Industry.

All payments for educational services provided by the institution in East Timor shall be made within 30 days of receipt of invoice, in the currency of the United States dollar (USD), and in accordance with the laws and regulations of East Timor, specifically adhering to the political regulations set forth on June 27, 2011. A late payment fee of 2% per month shall be applied to all outstanding balances after the due date.

SALE OF PREMISES: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Agreement to the contrary, in the event that the Premises are sold or otherwise transferred to a third party (the 'Buyer') after the Effective Date (January 17, 2010), the Buyer shall assume all of the obligations of the Seller under this Agreement related to the operation of the gasoline station located on the Premises, including but not limited to compliance with all applicable laws and regulations in the Multinational Market Regions in which the Premises are located, including those related to education and training of employees.

All invoices shall be paid within 30 days of receipt, with a 2% late fee per month applied to any outstanding balance, and shall be made in Kenyan Shillings (KES), unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both parties, in accordance with the laws of Kenya and regulations governing maritime trade in the Supply Chain Industry.

13. Work Order. The Supplier agrees to manufacture the fabricated metal products (the 'Products') ordered by the Purchaser in accordance with the specifications, drawings, and requirements set forth in the work order issued by the Purchaser (the 'Work Order'). The Supplier shall deliver the Products to the Purchaser's designated location in Asia within the timeframe specified in the Work Order. The Purchaser reserves the right to inspect the Products prior to acceptance and may reject any Products that do not meet the requirements of the Work Order. The Supplier shall be responsible for any costs incurred by the Purchaser as a result of the Supplier's failure to meet the requirements of the Work Order.

Grant of Rights. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, the Company hereby grants to the Investor a non-exclusive, non-transferable right and license to use the Company's proprietary information and intellectual property solely for the purpose of evaluating a potential investment in the Company, effective as of the date of this Agreement, March 7, 2004.

23.1 Redemption of Shares - The Company reserves the right to redeem the shares of any Employee who ceases to be employed by the Company or any of its subsidiaries in Italy, in accordance with the provisions of the Italian Civil Code and the applicable laws and regulations governing employee benefits in the Nonmetallic Mineral Product Manufacturing Industry. The redemption price shall be calculated based on the fair market value of the shares at the time of redemption, as determined by the Company's Board of Directors. The Employee shall be notified in writing of the Company's intention to redeem their shares at least 30 days prior to the date of redemption.

"Subsidiary" means any entity that is controlled by either party, where control is defined as the direct or indirect ownership of at least 50% of the voting shares, and for the purposes of this agreement, includes any such entity involved in the manufacture, distribution, or sale of household appliances, electric housewares, or consumer electronics in Europe.
